thread.title: Some 'Star Wars' fans take to Twitter claiming upcoming film is 'anti-white'
thread.title_full: Some 'Star Wars' fans take to Twitter claiming upcoming film is 'anti-white'

author: More Content Now
title: Some 'Star Wars' fans take to Twitter claiming upcoming film is 'anti-white'
text: Some 'Star Wars' fans take to Twitter claiming upcoming film is 'anti-white' Comment Aledo   More Content Now Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 9:46 AM By More Content Now Read the full story via The Las Vegas Review-Journal . The trailer for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" made its debut after Monday Night Football earlier this week, and it sparked an unexpected Twitter campaign from a certain subset of fans who claimed the film is "anti-white propaganda." Using the hashtag #BoycottStarWarsVII, some Twitter users seemed incensed that none of the movie's protagonists are white males, USA Today reported . On "The Daily Show," new host Trevor Noah poked fun of the movement : “Stop complaining, racists, you already had your ' Star Wars' movie,” Noah said, before putting up a photo of "fan favorite" prequel character Jar Jar Binks.
